text: A castle as large as any in Bretonnia and crowned by eight spires swirling with all the Winds of Magic, the Flying Fortress would be a marvel even if it was grounded.
From out of the mountains they came, a throng of vengeful dwarfs with the White Dwarf at their head. With hammer and shield, they brought the elves to ruin.
With the Hammer of Vaul the Runesmiths wrought miracles in stone and steel.
Within the Shrine of Vaul the Runesmiths labour, while Slayers journey across the ocean to hunt the last dragons of Ulthuan.
Slavers Gate, now liberated from the hateful elves, has been repurposed into a bustling port city, a safe harbour for ships bringing in supplies and reinforcements from Barak Varr.
Grand edifices built atop the convergences of ley lines amplify the magics of the Slann Mage-Priests manyfold.
Mixing powdered Warpstone with steel during the forging process creates weapons of wicked cutting prowess.

The Order of Merciful Sisters of Sigmar dedicate their lives to recovering Warpstone from across the world and bringing it to Sigmar's Rock for safekeeping. The Iron Dragon thanks them for their service.
When Kostaltyn emerged unscathed from the Trial of the Flame, all knew he had the Wolf-God's blessing.
The great domed Cathedral of Sigmar now stands humbly as one among many that dominate Altdorf's skyline, symbolising the triumph of a new faith.
The charred remains of Sylvania's counts are displayed as a warning to both commoner and noble alike: none may challenge the Great Orthodoxy.
Vast swathes of deforested fields stand testament to man's triumph over these wild lands.
With Harkon's pirates no longer threatening Imperial shipping lanes, the Huntsmarshal's expedition can receive more shipments from the mainland.
Here, the Huntsmarshal's impressive collection of hunting trophies are on display, a testament to the expedition's continued success in the hazardous jungles of Lustria.
The esoteric creations of the Old Ones once drove the dragons into dormancy. Now, with the Elves' guidance, they will bring about the next generation of dragons.
Spellsingers from Athel Loren have begun the arduous task of cleansing this tainted forest.
The Grey Seers have erected a crude device at the tower's highest point. It throbs with a sickly green glow.
Though the Dwarfs usually consider Elven craftsmanship shoddy at best, even they had to begrudgingly admit that the Starlight Forge was of peerless design.\\n
Though the Hammer of Vaul radiates with an ancient, godly power, Lord Daith wields it with effortless grace.
Within the great shrine of Vaul, Daith wields the fires of the very earth itself to craft weapons of peerless quality.
The burgomeisters have forsaken Handrich and embraced the Great Orthodoxy. Here they sell indulgences to those seeking remission for their sins in the next life.
The burgomeisters have A LOT of unpaid taxes…
The fell spirits that once haunted this wood have been driven back by faith, steel and gunpowder. The local lumberjacks have since capitalised on the situation.
The Slaughterer has erected a great cookpot in the centre of the Couronne tourney grounds. Ogres from many tribes journey to his newfound kingdom to participate in his frequent Great Feasts.
Couronne's Royarch rules the Bretonnians with an iron fist. It is said he never sleeps, never eats, and never removes his armour - such is his dedication to his people.
The withered husks of many Treemen stand testament to the Lichemaster's victory at Argwylon.

The Witch Hunters rounded up the blood-hungry nobles who once lorded over these lands and burned them all at the stake. Their constant vigilance is required to ensure Sylvania does not sink back into depravity.
